subject: p19182863
History: Followup of the patient with right lower lobe effusion developed after CABG, now with suspected recurrence.
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to. Since the prior studies, there is reaccumulation of the right pleural effusion, at least moderate. Post-sternotomy wires in a patient with history of replaced aortic and tricuspid valve are noted. There is no evidence of failure. The heart size and mediastinum are stable. No left pleural effusion is noted. No pneumothorax is seen. Note again is made that there is unchanged appearance of displaced fractures of first, second, and third ribs on the left.
